description: The project will be carried out at the Alexander Graham Bell Museum in Baddeck, Nova Scotia. The project will involve the removal and disposal of existing low slope roofing systems and supply and installation of new low slope roofing systems. The number of roofs, roof types and sizes of roofs is subject to change. Generally, the construction is expected to include labour, plant, material, tools, construction machinery and equipment, water, heat, light, power, transportation and other facilities and services required to perform the work.

# Stage 2 - Museum Re-Roofing at Alexander Graham Bell National Historic Site

## Tender Information

### Reference and Solicitation Details

* Tender Reference: CB-263-58674392
* Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0207/A-001
* Amendment Number: 3
* Publication Date: November 21, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: December 12, 2023, 1:00 PM EST
* Amendment Date: December 12, 2023
* Expected Contract Start Date: December 19, 2023
* Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2024

### Tender Status and Procurement Details

* Tender Status: Expired
* Procurement Category: CNST
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Variations or combinations of the above methods
* Limited Tendering Reason: None
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions for Opportunity and Delivery: Nova Scotia and Canada respectively

### Contracting Entity

* Contracting Entity: Parks Canada
* Address: 30 Victoria Street, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0T8, Canada
* Contact Information:
	+ Name: Christine Piché
	+ Email: [christine.piche@pc.gc.ca](mailto:christine.piché@pc.gc.ca)
	+ Phone Number: (873) 355-8841
	+ Fax Number: 1-855-983-1808

### Tender Description

The project involves the re-roofing of the Alexander Graham Bell Museum in Baddeck, Nova Scotia. The work includes:

* Removal and disposal of existing low-slope roofing systems
* Supply and installation of new low-slope roofing systems
* Work required to accommodate roof-top mechanical equipment and plumbing stacks
* Provision of storm water management
* Multiple activities requiring careful coordination and quality control

The tender process is a two-stage selection process where qualified suppliers are invited to provide a financial bid based on the specifications and drawings.
